trans-unit.source: +1: Until end of turn, up to one target creature gets +1/+1 and gains first strike, vigilance, and lifelink.\n−2: Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control and a loyalty counter on each other planeswalker you control.\n−7: You get an emblem with "If a source would deal damage to you or a planeswalker you control, prevent all but 1 of that damage."
trans-unit.target: +1：直到回合结束，至多一个目标生物得+1/+1且获得先攻，警戒与系命异能。 −2：在由你操控的每个生物上各放置一个+1/+1指示物，并在每个由你操控的其他鹏洛客上各放置一个忠诚指示物。 −7：你获得具有「如果某来源将对你或由你操控的鹏洛客造成伤害，则防止其中除了1点以外的所有伤害」的徽记。

trans-unit.source: Masters of the arcane savor a delicious irony. Their study of deep and complex arcana leads to such a simple end: the ability to say merely yes or no.

Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat. Any amount of damage a creature with deathtouch deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

trans-unit.source: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

trans-unit.source: Empires rise and fall, but evil is eternal.

trans-unit.source: "Feeding a normal army is a problem of logistics. With zombies, it is an asset. Feeding is why they fight. Feeding is why they are feared."\n—Jadar, ghoulcaller of Nephalia
trans-unit.target: 「正常的军队要考虑食粮补给的问题。而这正是灵俑部队的优点。他们因进食而战。也因进食而被人惧怕。」 ～涅非利亚尸鬼牧者贾达

trans-unit.source: Baby dragons can't figure out humans—if they didn't want to be killed, why were they made of meat and treasure?
trans-unit.target: 幼龙无法了解人类这种生物～既然不想被杀，那他们又为什么是用肉跟宝藏做的？

trans-unit.target: 「这里的生存方法很简单。适应山中法则，它就会对你好。与法则过不去，它就会吃了你。」 ～放荡烈焰术士奇烬

trans-unit.target: 半人骏马

trans-unit.source: "The centaurs are truly free. Never will they be tamed by temptation or controlled by fear. They live in total harmony, a feat not yet achieved by our kind."\n—Ramal, sage of Westgate
trans-unit.target: 「半人马享有真正的自由。他们永远不会因诱惑而被驯服，也不会因恐惧而遭控制。生活在完全的和谐中，这是我们族类尚未达到的境界。" ～西门智者拉默

trans-unit.source: "He has learned much in his long years. And unlike selfish humans, he's willing to share."\n—Garruk Wildspeaker
trans-unit.target: 「他的长寿让他多闻。而且与自私的人类不同，他很乐于分享。」 ～召兽使贾路
